attributes.action: appose the introduction of a 39th Premier League match played abroad.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On Thursday 7th February, the 20 Premier League clubs agreed to look into the possibility of playing an extra round of matches every season - abroad.

I am hoping that the prime minister will look into the many concerns that’s this proposal arises, solely for an increase in profits.

Many teams are already being bought out by foreign investors, who see huge profits in the English club market. This proposal will see their profits soar, and how much of this money will get put back into the game?

The league is currently balanced, with each team playing others twice, once home and once away. Surely adding a random extra game is simply unfair.

One major thing to look into should be the affect on the players. Already playing too many games, our English stars are tired and out of shape in comparison to other European leagues that play less games; This issue clearly visible by the team’s embarrassment to qualify for EURO 2008.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
